page.title: 06THE CASTLE AT CASTLE BYTHAM
page.content: All that remains of what was once the most dominant of buildings is a large grassy mound.It was probably built by a Norman called Drogo,a relative of William the Conqueror,who needed to defend himself from the last of the Saxons in these parts,Hereward the Wake and his nephews Edwin and Morcar.What was the castle like ? We can only tell a little from the remains_a moated site_ part of the moat still exists,but no longer goes right round the castle hill.Ontop of the hill would be a square "keep" surrounded by walls with towers at the corners.It is thought that possibly there was a larger tower at the N.E. corner.
